_exec_summary.SummaryText:
VanDeMark Chemical Inc. is a Responsible Care Company that emphasizes the health and safety of its workforce, the preservation of the environment and the health of the community in which we operate. We have very well structured programs that meet and/or exceed the regulatory requirements set forth by OSHA and the EPA.
Environmental, Health and Safety programs include Emergency Response Plan (ERP), Process Safety Management program; including subtopics and procedures for process safety information. Other important elements of PSM are employee involvement, process hazard analysis, prestart-up safety review, management of change (PMR), inclusion of SOPs and P&IDs, employee training, contractor supervision, mechanical integrity program, hot work program and permitting, incident investigation, lockout/tagout program, confined space entry program, and an environmental monitoring program. These programs demonstrate a consistent effort to minimize or eliminate potential releases; while providing for systematic responses should an emergency occur. Environmental monitoring includes numerous stationary detection devices used to identify minute chemical releases at ppm levels and to generate alarms for immediate response. We also have the ability to alert local emergency response services through redundant modes of communication as well as community siren for alerting our community and neighboring facilities. Based on RAGAGEP and Title V Air Permitting requirements, all instances of environmental alarms, both false and actual, are investigated and documented including findings and actions taken, if required.

This executive summary will provide a brief overview of the comprehensive risk management activities that we have designed and implemented, including:

Overview of our accidental release prevention programs

esponse program
Overview of planned changes to improve safety

This Risk Management Plan is being submitted to establish that a Risk Management Plan exists for the VanDeMark Chemical Inc. in Lockport New York.

Stationary Sources and Regulated Substances. 

VanDeMark Chemical Inc. located in Lockport, New York 14094, manufactures phosgene, phosgene derivatives and custom chemicals. The plant produces phosgene from chlorine and carbon monoxide in our B-5 Building and utilizes railcars of chlorine located just north of this building. The entire operation is secured with a continuous access control system and meets the security requirements of the Department of Homeland Security's Chemical Facility Anti-Terrorism Standard. Phosgene is the primary reagent that is the raw material in many of our other chemistries on site.
In summary, we have the following chemicals identified by the EPA as extremely hazardous substances:
Phosgene
Chlorine
Toluene-2,4-Diisocyanate

The accidental release prevention and emergency response.
As a Responsible Care Company, VanDeMark Chemical Inc. has a Corporate EHS Policy and a senior management team that is fully committed to protection of the Environment, the Health and Safety of our people, and the support and protection of our community. The VanDeMark team demonstrates this commitment through the frequent interaction with our stakeholders, and the sustained programs that meet and/or exceed regulatory requirements. Elements of these include:
Mechanical Integrity program
Excellent standard operating procedures that form the basis of our training program and that integrate regulatory requirements
Secondary containment within our operating areas to prevent accidental release
A comprehensive environmental monitoring program with active detection sensors for our chemistry
An Emergency Response Plan that is well trained and well-rehearsed with community resources in a Coordinated Emergency Response drill annually
Accident, i

ncident and near miss investigation program with root cause analysis and corrective measures tracking
Strong community involvement

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps.
VanDeMark Chemical Inc. falls under the OSHA Process Safety Management program. We foster creating layers of protection from unexpected, unwanted or undesirable situations. We have invested in a distributive control system (DCS) to aid in the monitoring of our chemistry. It also provides situational alarming as well as the capacity to limit, or to mitigate, incipient events before they can escalate to a more significant release. We have emergency generators to help facilitate emergency system functionality in the event of loss of power. We have 23 active monitoring devices strategically placed around the facility to provide early notice at parts-per-million levels of key RMP chemicals, as well as many other chemistries. Our people are well trained in both the operation of the facility and the mitigation of release events. As a Responsible Care Company, VanDeMark Chemical Inc, seeks to continuously improve our system to mitigate a release.
VanDeMark has a 3rd party PSM/RMP audit performed by an accredited organization every three years. Action items are tracked for completion. We also have a 3rd party Responsible Care Management System audit every 3 years with similar follow-up on opportunities raised.

The five-year accident history.
We have had no release events in the past 5 years.

The emergency response program.
VanDeMark Chemical has a comprehensive emergency response program and is an active member of our local emergency planning committee (LEPC). Our program is documented in our Emergency Response Plan (ERP). Part of the ERP includes coordination with local and regional emergency responders (City, County, as well as the Niagara Falls Airbase), in structured routine training, an annual coordinated emergency drill, and a Community A

dvisory Panel (CAP) for the communication and planning of the emergency response efforts at our facility. The CAP also serves as a feedback format for our community. We have redundant communication mechanisms in place for interacting both internally as well as with external ER resources. This includes VanDeMark access to the County emergency radio frequency as well as our community resources having access to our internal radio channels. The City's fire department participates in annual tours of our facility to understand both our operations and important response information such as utility locations and shutoff instructions. VanDeMark has a trained Hazmat Team and full response gear located in two separate locations in the plant to allow access for any situation. Also of note is a community siren that can be activated both internally as well as by the City of Lockport with a 75dB level at ¾ miles.
Planned changes to improve safety
Enhanced automation in our DCS (distributive control system)
More thermal cameras such as the one we recently installed in our waste storage area
We have a Community Advisory Panel Planned in April and a regional emergency drill planned at our facility in September 2022
Installation of heat/smoke detectors in MCC rooms
Installation of railroad track upgrades and improvements
Installation of fire safe valves on bottoms of storage tanks incrementally
Investigating options for automatic shutdown of phosgene cylinders in production areas
